'''4''' [[Supercopa de EspaÃ±a de Baloncesto|Spanish Supercups]] | website =[http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/basquet/index.html fcbarcelona.cat] |h_body=182657 |h_pattern_b=_fcbarcelona1112H |h_shorts=182657 |h_pattern_s=_fcbarcelona1112h |a_body=ff7d84 |a_pattern_b=_thinblacksides |a_shorts=ff7d84 |a_pattern_s= }} '''FC Barcelona BÃ squet''', known as '''FC Barcelona Regal''' for sponsorship reasons, is a Spanish professional [[basketball]] club. It is part of the [[FC Barcelona]] sports club and was founded on August 24, 1926 which makes it the oldest club in [[Liga ACB]]. The club competes in the [[Liga ACB|AsociaciÃ³n de Clubes de Baloncesto]] (ACB) and the [[Euroleague Basketball|Euroleague]]. It has won seven of the last thirteen ACB championships and in 2003 completed a Liga ACB, [[Copa del Rey de Baloncesto|Cup]] and Euroleague [[Triple Crown in Basketball|treble]]. FC Barcelona BÃ squet has played in seven Euroleague finals, with the last being their 2010 win. The team plays its home games at [[Palau Blaugrana]], which was opened on October 23, 1971. They share the facilities with the [[roller hockey]], [[futsal]] and [[Team handball|handball]] teams. Well-known players that have played with the team have included: [[Pau Gasol]], [[Rony Seikaly]], [[Marc Gasol]], [[Anderson VarejÃ£o]], [[Juan Carlos Navarro (basketball)|Juan Carlos Navarro]], [[Å arÅ«nas JasikeviÄius]], [[Dejan Bodiroga]], [[Gregor FuÄka]], [[Ricky Rubio]] and [[Tony Massenburg]]. FC Barcelona also has a [[FC Barcelona BÃ squet B|reserve team]] that plays in [[Liga EspaÃ±ola de Baloncesto|LEB Plata]]. ==History== ===Early years=== The club entered its first competition in 1927, playing in the ''Campionat de Catalunya de Basquetbol'' (Catalonian Basketball Championship). During these early years basketball in Catalonia was dominated by other clubs such as ''[[CE Europa]]'', ''LaietÃ  BC'', ''CB AtlÃ¨tic GrÃ cia'' and ''SociÃ©tÃ© Patrie'' and it was not until the 1940s that FC Barcelona became established as a basketball team. During this decade they won six ''Copas del GeneralÃ­simo'' and were runners-up once. In 1956 they were founding members of the [[Liga ACB|Spanish League]] and finished as runners-up. In 1959 they won Spanish basketball's first-ever league and cup double.[http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/basquet/intro_historica/historia_seccio.html HISTORY OF THE SECTION], fcbarcelona.com, accessed 29 December 2010. ===Decline in the 1960s=== The 1960s and 1970s saw the team in decline. In 1961 the club president Enric Llaudet dissolved the team in spite of its popularity. However, in 1962, the club was reformed after a campaign by the fans. In 1964 the league's ''Primera DivisiÃ³n'' was cut from fourteen teams to eight and the club found themselves in the ''Segunda DivisiÃ³n''. However they quickly returned to the top division after being crowned ''Segunda'' champions in 1965. During the 1970s the club was persistently overshadowed by its rivals [[Real Madrid Baloncesto|Real Madrid]] and [[Joventut Badalona|Joventut]]. ===Revival in the 1980s=== In the 1980s club president [[Josep LluÃ­s NuÃ±ez]] gave the team his full support with the aim of making the club the best in Spain and Europe. His support produced results and during the decade inspired by their coach [[AÃ­to GarcÃ­a Reneses]] and players like [[Juan Antonio San Epifanio|Epi]], [[AndrÃ©s JimÃ©nez]], [[CÃ¡ndido Sibilio|Sibilio]], [[Audie Norris]] and [[Nacho SolozÃ¡bal|SolozÃ¡bal]], the club won six Spanish League titles, five Copas del Rey, two [[Saporta Cup|European Cup Winners Cups]], the [[KoraÄ Cup]] and the World Championship. However the [[Euroleague|European Cup]] remained elusive. They were, however, runners-up in 1984. ===Champions of Europe=== The club built on this success during the 1990s, winning a further four Spanish League titles and two Copas del Rey. They were still unable to win the [[Euroleague|European Cup]] despite playing in a further four finals in 1990, 1991, 1996 and 1997. They also made a record six [[Euroleague|Final Four]] appearances. The star player during this era was [[Juan Antonio San Epifanio]]. Their persistence eventually paid off and in 2003, inspired by [[Dejan Bodiroga]], [[Gregor FuÄka]], [[Å arÅ«nas JasikeviÄius]] and [[Juan Carlos Navarro (basketball)|Juan Carlos Navarro]], they won the [[Euroleague]], beating [[Pallacanestro Treviso|Benetton Treviso]] 76â65 in front of a packed [[Palau Sant Jordi]] in [[Barcelona]]. ==Sponsorship naming== From 2004 until 2007 the club was sponsored by the [[Winterthur Group]], a [[Swiss]] insurance company with offices in Barcelona since 1910, which led to the team featuring the birthplace of [[Joan Gamper]], the club's founder, on their shirts. In 2006 the [[Winterthur Group]] was taken over by [[AXA]], leading to a change in the club name. In the 2008â09 season, the club's sponsorship changed to Spanish insurer Regal (a division of [[Liberty Seguros]], the Spanish subsidiary of American insurer [[Liberty Mutual]]). {| |- style="vertical-align: top;" | *FC Barcelona Banca Catalana 1993â97 *[[Winterthur Group|Winterthur]] FC Barcelona 2004â07 *[[AXA]] FC Barcelona 2007â08 *Regal FC Barcelona 2008â2011 *FC Barcelona Regal[http://www.marca.com/2011/06/22/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1308742979.html La UEFA autoriza la doble publicidad del Barcelona], MARCA.com, accessed 22 June 2011. 2011âPresent |} ==Home arenas== *Sol de Baix Sports Complex (1926â40) *Les Corts Court (1940â71), located next to [[Camp de Les Corts|Les Corts]] football stadium *[[Palau Sant Jordi]] (1990â92), after 1992 occasionally used for home games *'''[[Palau Blaugrana]]''' (1971â90, 1992âpresent) ==Players== {{see also|Category:FC Barcelona BÃ squet players}} ===Retired numbers=== * '''4''' AndrÃ©s JimÃ©nez, F, 1986â98 * '''7''' Nacho SolozÃ¡bal, G, 1978â94 * '''12''' [[Roberto DueÃ±as]], C, 1996â05 * '''15''' [[Juan Antonio San Epifanio]], F, 1979â95 ===Roster=== {{FC Barcelona BÃ squet roster}} ===Depth Chart=== {| style="text-align: center; background:#002FA7; color:white" !width="40"|Pos. !width="165"|Starter !width="165"|Bench !width="165"|Bench !width="165"|Reserve |-style="height:40px; background:white; color:black" ! style="background:red" | [[Center (basketball)|C]] | [[Fran VÃ¡zquez]]|| [[Kosta PeroviÄ]] ||[[Boniface N'Dong]] || || style="background:red" | |-style="height:40px; background:white; color:black" ! style="background:red" | [[Power forward (basketball)|PF]] | [[Erazem Lorbek]] || [[Charles Judson Wallace|C.J.
